intro: Lastrea bradei, commonly known as the Brade's lastrea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, adapting to harsh, dry conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, Lastrea bradei is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
